sentence: Some are nuisance candidates, but others are serious, such as GOP district chair Michele Woodhouse and Chuck Edwards, a state senator who represents a significant chunk of the new seat.
title: Opinion: Madison Cawthorn is in trouble. And it's entirely his own fault.

sentence: "It comes down to focus on the district, producing results for the district, and in my opinion, Mr. Cawthorn hasn't demonstrated much in the way of results over the last 18 months," Tillis told CNN, describing why he is backing state Sen. Chuck Edwards in his primary against Cawthorn.
author: Melanie Zanona, Manu Raju and Alex Rogers
title: 'He's an embarrassment': Republicans threaten to primary Cawthorn over controversial antics

sentence: "It comes down to focus on the district, producing results for the district, and in my opinion, Mr. Cawthorn hasn't demonstrated much in the way of results over the last 18 months," Tillis told CNN, describing why he is backing state Sen. Chuck Edwards in his primary against Cawthorn.
author: Melanie Zanona, Manu Raju and Alex Rogers
title: 'He's an embarrassment': Republicans threaten to primary Cawthorn over controversial antics

sentence: CNN reports that North Carolina senator Thom Tillis is now backing Cawthorn's primary opponent, an extraordinary broadside against a fellow Republican from his home state.? Other GOP lawmakers, for whom the allegations of Republicans being drug users and orgy enthusiasts apparently went too far, are also said to be considering endorsing one of his primary foes...amid growing concerns that the North Carolina Republican is dragging down the entire party with his problematic behavior.? According to CNN, the most powerful Republicans in North Carolina's state legislature, Phil Berger and Tim Moore, are headlining a fundraiser for State Senator Chuck Edwards, Cawthorn's opponent, on Thursday.
author: Bess Levin
title: Party That Excused Rioters Smearing Human S--t on the Walls of the Capitol Draws the Line at Cocaine and Orgy Allegations

sentence: Sen. Thom Tillis announced Wednesday that he was endorsing state Sen. Chuck Edwards' campaign to defeat freshman Rep. Madison Cawthorn in the May 17 Republican primary for North Carolina's 11th District, saying the next day that the incumbent has fallen well short of the most basic standards Western North Carolina expects from their representatives.? Tillis threw in an unsubtle reference to Cawthorn's previous attempt to leave his constituents behind to run for an even more conservative district in the Charlotte area that he barely represented before a new court-drawn map foreclosed that possibility, antics that likely did him far more damage at home than his litany of embarrassing behavior.
title: North Carolina senator endorses effort to deny renomination to Madison Cawthorn in May

title: Morning Digest: Why GOP leaders finally want to boot Madison Cawthorn (it's not really about orgies)

sentence: Thom Tillis, a GOP senator from Cawthorn's home state of North Carolina, announced that he would not be backing Cawthorn in his upcoming May primary, instead choosing to endorse one of his opponents, state Senator Chuck Edwards.
author: Adam Staten
title: Cawthorn to Speak at Trump Rally Despite GOP Fury Over Orgy, Cocaine Claim

sentence: Throwing his weight behind Cawthorn's challenger, Chuck Edwards, Tillis wrote that Edwards would "never embarrass Western North Carolina with a consistent pattern of juvenile behavior, outlandish statements, and untruthfulness."
author: Cheryl Teh
title: GOP leaders from Madison Cawthorn's home state are backing his primary challenger after the congressman's orgy comments

sentence: Tillis has endorsed Cawthorn's primary opponent, state Sen. Chuck Edwards, who has also been backed by a number of other Republicans, including North Carolina state Sen. Phil Berger and House Speaker Tim Moore.
author: Jon Skolnik
title: Madison Cawthorn called out for "lying" in new ad funded by Republican senator's super PAC
